title: Ben Lam
text:
Misimoa Benjamin Lam (born 9 June 1991) is a New Zealand professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He won a <a href="Glasgow%20Commonwealth%20Games">Glasgow Commonwealth Games</a> silver medal in 2014 in the <a href="Rugby%20sevens">Rugby sevens</a>.
Career.
Lam played <a href="Wing%20%28rugby%20union%29">wing</a> for <a href="Mitre%2010%20Cup">Mitre 10 Cup</a> team <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Auckland</a>. He was selected for the Auckland and Blues sides in 2012. He played 12 games for Auckland after making his debut in 2012 against <a href="Hawke%27s%20Bay%20Rugby%20Union">Hawke's Bay</a>. He made one <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> appearance for the <a href="Auckland%20Blues">Auckland Blues</a> in 2012. In November 2012 he entered into a contract as a New Zealand sevens player, making his debut at the <a href="Dubai%20Sevens">Dubai Sevens</a>. Lam won a silver Commonwealth Games Medal as a member of the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">All Black Sevens team</a> at the <a href="Glasgow%20Commonwealth%20Games">Glasgow Commonwealth Games</a> in 2014. Lam has international experience with the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Sevens">New Zealand Sevens</a>. Since 2017 he has played for the <a href="Hurricanes%20%28rugby%20union%29">Hurricanes</a>.
Personal.
Lam was born in Auckland, a nephew of rugby player <a href="Pat%20Lam">Pat Lam</a>. He was educated at <a href="St%20Peter%27s%20College%2C%20Auckland">St Peter's College</a>, where he played rugby in the college First XV and excelled at athletics, principally in the <a href="100%20metres">100 metres</a> (breaking 11 seconds) and <a href="200%20metres">200 metres</a>, as well as the <a href="long%20jump">long jump</a>. In Wellington, while giving his services to the Hurricanes franchise, Lam is completing his degree in Geography and Marine Biology and pursues his interest in <a href="underwater%20diving">underwater diving</a> around <a href="Breaker%20Bay">Breaker Bay</a>. He likes reading and he and other Hurricanes players <a href="Ardie%20Savea">Ardie Savea</a>, <a href="Chris%20Eves">Chris Eves</a> and <a href="Blade%20Thomson">Blade Thomson</a> have promoted a book club.
